sample_values: 🎓 PURDUE '26 | 🎓 TJHSST '22 |  🔭 2x Founder | 🧠 AI Researcher | 💻 Full Stack Developer | 🦅 Eagle Scout
options: 🎓 PURDUE '26 | 🎓 TJHSST '22 |  🔭 2x Founder | 🧠 AI Researcher | 💻 Full Stack Developer | 🦅 Eagle Scout

sample_values: Hello! I'm an eager Purdue Engineer in the Startup/VC world! Over the past few years, I have built a wide variety of projects- ranging from an autonomous photography drone, a liquid-fueled rocket engine, a novel sports analytics product, and a cutting edge agriculture stereo imaging system.  𝗜 𝗮𝗺 𝗻𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝗶𝗱𝗹𝗲.  You will see me constantly coding a side project or buying materials from McMaster. Here are some of my current projects: - A powerful music analytics database compiled from the Spotify, Genius, Musixmatch, and YouTube APIs. As far as I have found it is the largest single compiled database from all these sources. My goal is to analyze trends from over 400 GB of data to predict which artist will have the next big song, how words/phrases are trending over time, and how "genres" of music are clustered in our mind.   - A mobile application used to schedule rowing lineups weeks in advance and integrate rowers statistics more directly into the lineup creating process. Using Flutter and Firebase, I am working to help coaches make the fastest boats possible for their teams.  My real passion lies in entertainment technology- projects like innovative roller coaster designs, visual and audial spatial mapping, AI generated music, and whatever technologies will take over the future of entertainment. I have a Notion page full of ideas that I add to multiple times a day.  𝗜 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻 𝗳𝗮𝘀𝘁.  One side effect of having a wide variety of interests is that I have learned how to quickly research topics and learn new software. Just in my free time, I have learned how to use Blender, Unity, OBS, Logic Pro, and Final Cut. I learned react native in just two weeks, then built a backend on Express and EC2 in days.  𝗜 𝗮𝗺 𝗮 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼𝗼.  When I was 15 years old, I brought together 50+ volunteers to help revitalize an area of a local park. I learned the importance of being confident and decisive, yet cordial. Since then, I have led many project teams across different goals and disciplines. I learned to be accountable to school sponsors, assign meaningful tasks to team members, and command attention during introductions or presentations.  My leadership was pushed hardest when I recruited and led a year-long research project developing a new data collection product for my crew team. I learned how to empower my engineers to be most productive through communication, planning, and emphasizing focus on our goal. Most importantly, I learned how to organize myself and jump between very technical and large-scale goals quickly.

Using Flutter and Firebase, I am working to help coaches make the fastest boats possible for their teams.  My real passion lies in entertainment technology- projects like innovative roller coaster designs, visual and audial spatial mapping, AI generated music, and whatever technologies will take over the future of entertainment. sample_values: Sebastian Illing agreed. any updates? we have no access still.

• Led a small team to build a generative AI entertainment app. Built unique creation algorithms to generate pieces of content dynamically as the user interacted with the app.  • Built on top of generative AI tools such as Stable Diffusion, GPT-4, Langchain, MusicLM, Runway, etc to create many modalities of entertainment. Created meta-prompting architectures to adapt these creations to user preferences over time. Some of these models were implemented into production with days of their release.

• Led development of iOS app. Used Xcode, swift, javascript, firebase, and postman to build scalable fullstack code. Iterated from user feedback to adapt our user interface to be more intuitive. • Managed backend database of several thousand users. Created rigorously tested endpoints and optimized backend calls. Interacted with several external APIs.

sample_values: Cert Prep: Unity Certified Associate Game Developer UI and 2D Games
Advanced Java: Hands-on with Streams, Lambda Expressions, Collections, Generics and More

Got a great idea for a 2D game? In this course, explore the fundamentals of user interfaces, animation, and level design in Unity as you learn how to create a 2D game of your own. The concepts covered in this course can also help you prepare to tackle the sections of the Unity Certified Associate: Game Developer exam that focus on user interfaces and 2D gaming. Instructor Alan Thorn covers the basics of creating a user interface, explaining how to make labels and buttons that allow users to interact with your scenes. He also goes into the fundamentals of creating sprite animations, configuring your 2D world, and working with 2D tiles.

Are you experienced in Java, but looking to get your skills to the next level? Join Maaike van Putten in this course and take your Java programming from good to great. Maaike covers a series of advanced Java topics, including streams and lambda expressions, collections and generics, and custom annotation. She also shows you how to deal with concurrency and work with the singleton design pattern. Join Maaike in this hands-on course, test what you’ve learned in a series of challenges, and compare your work to Maaike’s solutions.

This course includes Code Challenges powered by CoderPad. Code Challenges are interactive coding exercises with real-time feedback, so you can get hands-on coding practice alongside the course content to advance your programming skills.

Want to work smarter in SketchUp Pro? In this weekly series, instructor Rebecca Terpstra shares tips designed to help users enhance their SketchUp skills in their spare time. Rebecca offers her expert take on how to create precision-based models for your architectural and interior designs with this powerful 3D modeling application. Discover how to use the Paste in Place function to quickly and accurately group objects that belong together, use scenes effectively, make a variety of shapes using the Circle tool, and much more.

I've been working on technology out of science fiction. "
""
"In the past week I have built a fully automated AI browser that you can interact with through only voice. "
""
"The goal? Tell your web browser what to do at a very high level."
" -> "Navigate to Purdue Brightspace and download my assignments for this week""
"-> "Navigate to YC and fill out the application for my company""
""
"The most powerful automation applications are grounded in Authentication and contextual data.  This where EVERY other AI tool falls short."
""
"We maintain your authentication, just like Chrome, so you can still access all your normal websites. NO OTHER AI SYSTEM CAN DO THIS. "
""
"This has huge impacts for millions of people that cannot access the web easily today due to disabilities or knowledge gap."
""
"My grandma can barely book flights on her computer, but she definitely could talk to an AI that could :)"
""
"Follow progress here --> https://x.com/JackBlair87 or on LinkedIn"
""
"Our product is called Surfer"
""
"If you think this is interesting, please repost so others can gain more exposure to what we are working on!"
""
"If you are technical and want to help, send a message to me!"
""
""
"#AI #purdue #homeworkautmation #VoiceControlledWeb #AIBrowser #WebAccessibility #TechInnovation #FutureOfBrowsing #AIAssistant #VoiceCommands #AccessibleTech #InclusiveTechnology #ElderlyTech #DisabilityTech #WebAutomation #AIAutomation #SmartBrowsing #VoiceActivated #AIforSeniors

I'm thrilled to announce that I'll be spending the next 4 months at The Residency program at UC Berkeley! 🎉 This is a truly incredible opportunity to immerse myself in the heart of the Bay Area's AI and technology innovation ecosystem."
""
"For the past 4+ years, I've been pouring my passion into coding side projects, launching startups, researching the frontiers of AI, and bringing together brilliant entrepreneurial minds. And now, I get to take that experience to the next level at the Residency."
""
"I'll be surrounded by some of the sharpest thinkers and most innovative doers in the world, all collaborating to push the boundaries of what's possible with technology. My goal is to develop groundbreaking AI ideas that can meaningfully improve people's lives."
""
"A huge thank you to Nick Linck and Hardeep Gambhir for making this opportunity a reality. I'm honored and eager to make the most of it."
""
"Stay tuned for updates on the amazing projects and collaborations that come out of this experience. 🔥"
""
"#Residency #UCBerkeley #AI #Innovation #Entrepreneurship

What a thrilling weekend to be part of Purdue University's history! 🎉"
""
"For the first time ever, Purdue Founders joined forces with ML@Purdue to launch 'Catapult' - an unprecedented AI + Business hackathon! 🚀✨"
""
"STEM and Business minds fused to create viable startups in just 24 hours, forming a product and converting the idea into a compelling pitch deck. Over 50+ unique startup ideas were conceived, and 21 teams had the opportunity to pitch their innovative solutions. 💡🌐"
""
"Our esteemed judges – Eugenio Culurciello, Raymond Yeh, and Tony Vernon, gave feedback that left us feeling enlightened. An enormous round of applause to the team who pulled together this event in record time - unparalleled teamwork in action."
""
"For a comprehensive overview of the event and to see the brilliant projects, visit https://lnkd.in/ex7R-T9Y. Again, a huge shoutout to the Catapult's backbone - Sameeha Afrulbasha, Saisravani Kuchibhotla, Leo Deng, Jinen Setpal, Connor Johnson, and Shantanu Roy and to all participants whose unwavering determination was inspirational. 🌠 🎆"
""
"This event has led to the Purdue Founders ecosystem doubling in size in just half a semester, revealing how we can grow and innovate collectively. These milestones, like Catapult, fuel our enthusiasm and prove that the sky's the limit. But this is just the beginning! 🚀"
""
"On a more personal note, it was incredible to see the logistics and challenges behind planning an event of this scale. Even more energizing events are queued up for our vibrant Purdue community. Stay tuned as we continue to Catapult our way to success! 🎉"
"#Purdue #PurdueEntrepreneurship #Startups #Hackathon #PurdueCatapult #PurdueFounders #StartupPurdue #MLPurdue #MachineLearning #AI

Announcing Purdue Catapult Hacks 2024 🚀🌀"
"Apply here by March 18th!! (http://catapulthacks.com/)"
""
"Purdue Founders and ML@Purdue are teaming up and so proud to announce Catapult - Purdue University's first ever AI + Entrepreneurship Hackathon. 🧠💡"
""
"As a Purdue student working and studying in the AI industry, I've been interested in not only learning about the theoretics of AI/ML in my classes, but also building with the leading technologies available to us today. I've always believed in learning by doing, 🛠️ and believe that Purdue University needs more opportunities for students to build and brand generative AI based projects. This is why we are hosting Purdue’s first ever GenAI + Business Hackathon. 🏗️📚"
""
"The Hackathon (called Catapult Hacks) is a university-wide two day in-person event (3/30-3/31) for students across Purdue’s ecosystem to build, learn, and create AI based applications. 📆 In a unique twist, our hackathon is both a coding challenge and business challenge. Not only must teams utilize the newest AI tech, but they must brand and pitch each idea, being judged on a combination of both by VCs + Purdue Alumni. 💼💻"
""
"No AI or hackathon experience is required! Teams can be students from any school, but must attend in-person. Join Purdue’s top builders for over $2,000 in prizes, even sponsored by Purdue's very own purdue Institute for Physical Artificial Intelligence. 💰"
""
"The team- Sameeha Afrulbasha, Connor Johnson, Shantanu Roy, Saisravani Kuchibhotla and I have poured hundreds of hours enabling this opportunity for hundreds of Purdue students. 🙏🏽"
""
"Now that you have this incredible opportunity, make the most of it! If you are a student, apply here: http://catapulthacks.com/ by March 18th, 2024 to get involved. We are still looking for sponsors and judges!! If you want to help, you can find out more information here: https://lnkd.in/g_wFb3kB"
""
"Message me personally if you have any questions! 👋 Also reach out to Samsheeha, Connor, or Shantanu. "
""
"Thank you to our sponsors and organizers for helping to make this happen! 🎊👏"
"ML@Purdue, Purdue Founders, Purdue University, Rithwik Erabelly, Pradyun Kamaraju, HawkenIO

Thrilled to announce the kickoff of Purdue's inaugural Catapult - the first-ever Start-up and AI Hackathon at Purdue! 🚀 Dive into the heart of Purdue's AI + ML community with this groundbreaking event. https://lnkd.in/g3tr7U3P"
""
"If you are at all interesting in supporting entrepreneurship or AI research at Purdue, please consider becoming a sponsor. https://lnkd.in/eMm6UC4h "
""
"We are looking for designers and marketers!! If you want to help us in any way, please reach out to me, Connor Johnson or Sameeha Afrulbasha! "
""
"Applications coming soon!! Mark your calendars for March 30-31st!

AI Agents have a problem – they lack real-time access to critical context that could enhance their problem-solving capabilities."
""
"We've tried, RAG, embeddings, etc, but sometimes the best tool is yourself."
"I built a Python API that enables your AI agents to contact a human when they get stuck, with just four lines of code and a simple mobile app."
""
"Try it out: https://lnkd.in/gW84Rqam "
""
"As a student founder, I am always looking for feedback! Send me a DM!

🏆  Exciting News! 🏆 "
"Thrilled to share my triumph at #BoilermakeXI with my very first solo hackathon project - AutoScholar! 🎉 Imagine having your own personal research assistant right in your pocket, tirelessly sifting through 2.4 million research papers to find the gems tailored to your interests. https://lnkd.in/dtKMFqGB "
""
"Keep up to date on research! AutoScholar adapts to your preferences and even sends you daily notifications for new publications in your field. 🌐 A big shout out to #Boilerbookings, Pradyun Kamaraju, and Rithwik Erabelly for awarding it as the "Best Hack for Purdue Students" – an honor I truly cherish. Check out their amazing work here https://lnkd.in/dvrPR4WX"
""
"Special thanks to Rohan Purandare and the entire BoilerMake team for making this event so inspiring! 🙌 It was great to see the entire AI + hacking community come together for amazing projects. "
""
"Building AutoScholar at lightning speed wouldn't have been possible without the magic of Spooky AI's HumanAPI ✨ This iOS app and messaging platform empower me to create context-rich notifications and seamlessly integrate AI data in just four lines of code. I have been building it over the past few months and will officially launch very soon! https://lnkd.in/dETC4aFK"
""
"Calling all AI enthusiasts, cognitive architecture buffs, and Purdue entrepreneurs! Let's connect and explore future collaborations. 🤝 Passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology? Join me in shaping the future where technology works for you! Send me a DM or come to Purdue Founders every Saturday!!"
""
"#Boilermake #Purdue #AI #CognitiveArchitecture #AutoScholar #HumanAPI #Research #Innovation #StudentStartup #PurdueFounders #PurdueHacking 🚀

🚀 Exciting News! 🚀 Thrilled to share that we won the Fall 2023 award program at Purdue's John Martinson Entrepreneurial Center (JMEC) with SVBIG! 🏆🌟"
""
"Teaming up with the brilliant minds of Thomas Stahura and Sahil Lalani, we've crafted an AI assistant architecture that feels like futuristic magic! 🤖✨ Picture this: an assistant that keenly observes, gathers data about you, and then proactively takes actions on your behalf. It's like having a tech-savvy sidekick, always ready for life's twists and turns. 🔄🌐"
""
"A huge thank you to Purdue Founders – the core force of student entrepreneurship at Purdue University! Special appreciation to all the incredible student entrepreneurs who played a pivotal role in our success. Your collaboration and feedback at Purdue Founders have been instrumental. 🚀🌟"
"A heartfelt thank you to Rachael Vonderhaar! 🌟 As a Student Research Assistant at JMEC, her support was invaluable throughout the process."
""
"To everyone who believed in our vision and contributed to this journey – THANK YOU! 🙌 Exciting times ahead as we continue to innovate and shape the future of AI Agent systems. Stay tuned for more updates! 🚀🔗 #JMEC #SVBIG #InnovationJourney #AIRevolution #PurdueEntrepreneurship #PurdueFounders #StudentEntrepreneurs

I am so proud to have had the opportunity to complete my Senior Research Project in the Robotics and Automation Laboratory at TJHSST with Onur Gunduz, Nicholas Rising, and Nicholas Bonanno. "
""
"Over the past year, we have created a device that mounts on a Crew shell and collects never-before-seen data to help coaches select the best line-ups for their boats."
""
"https://lnkd.in/gsajpTQa "
""
"Crew has been a huge part of my life over the past four years, and it is an honor to give back. Please watch the video below and feel free to send advice and questions. We'll follow up with a formal research paper in a few days."
""
"Special thanks to our Automation and Robotics Lab Director, Mrs. Kristen Kucko, for the year-long support and mentorship she has given to us.
Purdue JMEC Fall 2023 Entrepreneurial Award with SVBIG

sample_values: I joined cub scouts in 2009 and have loved scouting ever since. At age fifteen, I completed my Eagle Scout Project at Sandy Run Regional Park, where I row for crew. I felt that it was only fitting to give back to a place that has given me so much enjoyment over the past three years.  Throughout my scouting career I have held many leadership positions including Patrol Leader, Assistant Senior Patrol Leader, Historian, and Webmaster. I like to teach other scouts skills like orienteering, packing, knot tying.
I worked with two fellow students to develop a CV software that pairs cars parked in contactless delivery parking spots with their corresponding order. (Curbside Classifier)
Rowed on my crew team's 1V boat Junior and Senior year.
options: I joined cub scouts in 2009 and have loved scouting ever since. At age fifteen, I completed my Eagle Scout Project at Sandy Run Regional Park, where I row for crew. I felt that it was only fitting to give back to a place that has given me so much enjoyment over the past three years.  Throughout my scouting career I have held many leadership positions including Patrol Leader, Assistant Senior Patrol Leader, Historian, and Webmaster. I like to teach other scouts skills like orienteering, packing, knot tying.
I worked with two fellow students to develop a CV software that pairs cars parked in contactless delivery parking spots with their corresponding order. (Curbside Classifier)
Rowed on my crew team's 1V boat Junior and Senior year.
My team and I developed a software capable of translating spoken text into 3D objects using the Fusion360 API and a STT library. (SpeechToCAD)

It's like having a tech-savvy sidekick, always ready for life's twists and turns. 🔄🌐

sample_values: This is my fully autonomous drone build, with over 30 minutes of flight time and a gimbaled GoPro! I have spent almost a year on this project and have completed over 4 autonomous flights.

The SmartSkeg system is a set of wireless devices placed on a Crew shell to gain insights into how the rowers are performing, as well as actively steer the boat to avoid obstacles. Using our technology, coaches can monitor statistics in real time and see how different combinations of rowers affect the speed of the boat.   Created by Jack Blair, Nicholas Bonanno, Onur Gunduz, and Nicholas Rising.

Over the course of coronavirus break, I designed a fully autonomous RC Cybertruck that can go faster than 30 MPH! I put in more than 100+ hours and am very proud of the final design. Using the Pixhawk flight controller I also was able to complete autonomous waypoint missions.

I have been wanting to learn about cognitive architectures in AI systems for a long time. But, as it turns out, delving into such a complex research topic on a whim at 3 AM in the morning is not sustainable. To combat this, I've been trying to read summaries of newer research papers every day.   That's why I build AutoScholar- A simple AI Agent to search the internet every day for research papers relevant to my area of interest (in this case, cognitive architectures!). The agent beautifully summarizes each paper it finds- with an emphasis on impact of the paper- and intelligently sends papers to me it thinks I would find interesting.   As an AI Agent Engineer, I have a lot of experience building with generative AI tools such as GPT-4 and LangChain. To build this particular workflow, I used an automated scheduling tool called n8n to start a LangChain thread that has access to an arXiv tool, allowing it to search through research papers. That system layered with additional summarization prompts and repetition checking allowed me to send relevant papers every few hours (or however often I want). To display the results of the agent to the user, I used Spooky AI's Human API app, which allowed me to send the notifications.

As AI assistants become more sophisticated, autonomous agents are increasingly tackling complex tasks without human initiation. While this enhances their ability to take meaningful actions on our behalf, it raises concerns about real-time supervision and execution accuracy.   Spooky's HumanAPI to solve the problem: How can AI cloud agents ask us questions when don't have enough information or are not sure what steps to take next?  Get Started Here: https://app.archbee.com/public/PREVIEW-kBSfW0x0YaVY-EXPqYbHY/PREVIEW-h0nsaRf45zhMhJ0oHrBdJ  If you are interested in this type of work, please contact me here: http://jack-blair.com

Depletables are my way of modeling recurring tasks that you must be on top of to be spontaneous. A Depletable is any cyclical task that has a state of “depletion.” Instead of reactively responding to tasks like home cleaning, shopping, connecting with family, a Depletable notifies you when to accomplish all of these tasks.  To track Depletables, I developed an iPhone app and launched it on the App Store. Instead of saving all my tasks for the dreaded Sunday cleaning, I get an iPhone notification to complete them throughout the week. As a student, this is a great way to balance busy work days and allows me to spend time on the weekend doing what I truly want to do- being spontaneous.  I made a Depletable to clean my bathroom, change my contacts, and clean the fridge. I also made Depletables to text my family members each week and post consistently on social media. After using this app for the past few months, I can genuinely say it has changed the way I live.  By combining Depletables for recurring tasks, a calendar for date-based tasks, a to-do list for random tasks, and time-chunking my continuous tasks, I have built a system that allows me to operate ahead of my deadlines and accomplish more than I thought possible.
